questions.text: During your ophthalmology classes, your professor was teaching you about Sturm's conoid, which denotes the bundle of rays refracted through a toric surface. Which of the following images below depicts the type of refraction error in which it is found?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

C In the given question, image C depicts astigmatism , which occurs when the refractory surfaces are uneven and have different curvatures, forming two foci where rays gather. The entire bundle of rays is called a Sturms conoid, and the distance between the two foci is called a focal interval of Sturm. Astigmatism is a condition of refraction in which a point of focus of light cannot be formed upon the retina. The optical condition is that instead of a In a single focal point, there are two or more focal lines (depending on the type of Astigmatism), separated from each other by a focal interval.

Highyeild:

Etiological classification: Curvature astigmatism : Most commonly , it is corneal, where vertical Curvature is more than horizontal curvature (due to the pressure of the upper. Eyelid), less commonly, it is lenticular (induced by lens). Decentering astigmatism : subluxation of lens. Index astigmatism : due to cataract in one meridian.

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Image A depicts hypermetropia in which the rays focus behind the retina, but the refractory surfaces are even. Option: B. Image B depicts myopia in which the rays focus in front of the retina the refractory surfaces are even.

Extraedge:

Clinical classification: Regular : two principle meridians at the right angle are involved (i.e., there is the difference in the refractive power of two meridians 90° in between): A- Simple astigmatism : myopic or hypermetropic; one of the foci falls on Retina, other in front or behind it.

If he tries to see them, he suffers from blurring vision, burning sensation in the eyes, and headache. On a cover-uncover test, the child is also found to have esophoria. After evaluating the refractory error, he was found to have a refractory error at point D in the given image. Which of the following statements is not true regarding this?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the most common type of astigmatism seen.

options.label: C
options.text: This point is also known as the circle of least diffusion.

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Associated with maximum symptoms. In the given question, the clinical symptoms are described along with the presence of astigmatism that is present at point D , which is mixed astigmatism ; the incorrect statement is option B. At point D , the vertical rays have diverged exactly as much as the horizontal rays have converged towards it. Option: A. The type of refractive error that will be present will be mixed astigmatism, where the vertical rays diverge, and the horizontal rays converge. It is the most common type of astigmatism Hence here, the section will be a circle, which is called the circle of least diffusion Here the patient will have the least symptoms.

questions.text: A 28-year-old female who has corneal astigmatism now is having increased visual symptoms like pain around the eye, blurred vision, burning eyes, headache, and increased sleep. The ophthalmologist advised her to undergo pterygium removal. Which of the following is the best surgery to treat corneal astigmatism?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Astigmatic C-LASIK. In the given clinical scenario, the patient now has increased asthenopic symptoms due to corneal astigmatism. Hence he should undergo surgical correction. The best technique to treat corneal astigmatism is astigmatic C-LASIK.
